text: Is there an easy way to find a value from a generator and return the index? The generator may be infinite.

elements.text: Is there an easy way to find a value from a generator and return the index? The generator may be infinite.

text: Once <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/34678> is merged, you can just use `findfirst` for this

elements.text: is merged, you can just use

text:
Or, if you want to be a :pirate: :
```julia> Base.keys(g::Base.Generator) = keys(g.iter)

julia> findfirst(==(4), i^2 for i in 1:4)
2```

elements.text: Or, if you want to be a

julia> Base.keys(g::Base.Generator) = keys(g.iter)

julia> findfirst(==(4), i^2 for i in 1:4)
2

text:
Interesting... what about iterators? e.g.
```struct InfiniteSquares end

Base.iterate(s::InfiniteSquares, state=1) = (state * state, state + 1)```

elements.text:
struct InfiniteSquares end

Base.iterate(s::InfiniteSquares, state=1) = (state * state, state + 1)

text:
Argh... Looks like I can just do
```julia> first(i for (i,x) in enumerate(InfiniteSquares()) if x == 9)
3```

elements.text: Argh... Looks like I can just do

julia> first(i for (i,x) in enumerate(InfiniteSquares()) if x == 9)
3
